ygData.subject: Something's wrong...
ygData.msgSnippet: (Sorry I haven t been posting. Our school just switched to block scheduling and I have a TON of homework almost every night. I got lucky tonight ^_^) Tavatron

(Sorry I haven't been posting. Our school just switched to block scheduling 
and I have a TON of homework almost every night. I got lucky tonight ^_^)

Tavatron breathed deeply of the fresh night air, the silver moonlight 
causing her eyes to shimmer in the growing darkness. If she hadn't been a 
'bot always on the move, doing what she had to survive, she would gladly 
settle here. It was perfect. Tavatron's gazed drifted across the glade, 
watching as the blades of grass danced in the gentle wind.

"Just give me a second."

Tavatron closed her eyes and tried to take in every sound, each individual 
smell seeming to grow in volume as she concentrated not on what she saw, but 
on what she felt. She flicked her ear in slight distress as an odd smell, 
foriegn to the peaceful glade, reached her sensitive nose. It had a metallic 
taste to it, one she found quite unpleasent.

Try as she might she couldn't shale the feeling that something wasn't right. 
That smell, it just kept nagging at her senses. Tavatron knew she wouldn't 
be sastisfied until she discovered the source of the troublesome scent. She 
turned to face Dinobot, about to ask him if he noticed it as well. She 
recognized the scent, she just couldn't put her claw on it! What WAS that 
smell?! Finally it struck her, causing her to pull her ears back in slight 
distress. It was the smell of mech-fluid, why she hadn't recognized it 
immediatly she had no idea, but the important thing was that she did now.

"Are you allright?"

Tavatron raised a questining eye-ridge as she walked over to her traveling 
companion. She was farely certain her injuries were healed, and positve the 
smell was coming from his direction. Tavatron didn't even wait for a 
response as she stood before him. Despite his impressive sizeand skill even 
the most experienced 'bot couldn't sustain serious damage.

Tavatron raised an unsteady hand, something was wrong, seriously wrong. 
Every circuit told her so. With much hesitance she brushed her fingers 
against his chest, letting her gaze rest momentarily on the silver fluid 
that dripped from her claws. As her eye-sight ajusted to the darkness she 
finally saw what was wrong, what had been bothering her so. Dinbot was 
injured, severely. This was one time when his need to help others and uphold 
his code of honor was NOT helping matters. He should have told her. They 
could have set out earlier, giving him a better chance to make it back to 
base with some mech-fluid left.

Tavatron raised her eyes, setting them level with his. The moonlight was 
reflecting off his silver armor in the still night. The occasional cricket 
breaking the growing silence. She had never really looked at him before, not 
like this. He had beautiful armor, something she was actually kindof jealuos 
of. Her fur was always matted or in need of a good brushing. Something she 
never really had time for.

Tavatron smiled up at him, the concern was evident in her face though she 
tried her best to hide it:

"I guess we better get going."
